intro: Trichanthecium nervosum, commonly known as the veined trichanthecium, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa and the Middle East. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant has slender, branching stems and small, narrow leaves with prominent veins. Its flowers are typically yellow or orange, arranged in clusters, and it produces small, capsule-like fruits. Trichanthecium nervosum is often found in dry, open habitats and is adapted to arid environments.
